Description: Shell of a land gastropod mollusc of 'Pila Ovata' species (edible snail).
Curator's comments: This shell has a note left by Petrie: 'Ampullaria ovata Nile. Nebireh Naucratis 1885 Roman strata'. Ampullaria ovata (= Lanisters Ovata) is incorrectly identified. Now identified as Pila ovata which is an indigenous species, that is edible like Helix pomatia (edible snail). Helix pomatia (edible snail) were also found at Naukratis and the Red Sea port of Myos Hormos and the quarry Mons Claudianus in Roman levels (Hamilton- Dyer 2011, 273). From Europe and not native to Egypt, Helix pomatia may have been introduced to the Nile (ibid. 272).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WC.15)
